query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 «O tu che vai, non per esser più tardo, 17 ma forse reverente, a li altri dopo, 18 rispondi a me che ’n sete e ’n foco ardo.
query.result:
**English:**
16 "O you who go, not to be slower, 17 but perhaps more reverent, after the others, 18 answer me who burn in thirst and fire.
**Malay:**
16 "Wahai kamu yang pergi, bukan untuk menjadi lebih lambat, 17 tetapi mungkin lebih hormat, setelah yang lain, 18 jawablah aku yang terbakar dalam dahaga dan api.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Né solo a me la tua risposta è uopo; 20 ché tutti questi n’hanno maggior sete 21 che d’acqua fredda Indo o Etïopo.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Nor is your answer needed by me alone; 20 for all these have a greater thirst for it 21 than Indians or Ethiopians have for cold water.
**Malay:**
19 Bukan hanya aku yang membutuhkan jawabanmu; 20 karena semua orang ini lebih haus akannya 21 daripada orang India atau Etiopia yang haus akan air dingin.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Dinne com’ è che fai di te parete 23 al sol, pur come tu non fossi ancora 24 di morte intrato dentro da la rete».
query.result:
**English:**
22 Tell me how it is that you make yourself a wall 23 to the sun, even though you have not yet 24 entered the net of death».
**Malay:**
22 Katakan padaku bagaimana kamu menjadikan dirimu sebagai dinding 23 untuk matahari, meskipun kamu belum 24 memasuki jaring kematian».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Tosto che parton l’accoglienza amica, 38 prima che ’l primo passo lì trascorra, 39 sopragridar ciascuna s’affatica:
40 la nova gente: «Soddoma e Gomorra»; 41 e l’altra: «Ne la vacca entra Pasife, 42 perché ’l torello a sua lussuria corra».
query.result:
**English:**
37 As soon as they depart from the friendly welcome, 38 before the first step is taken there, 39 each one strives to outshout the other:
40 the new people: “Sodom and Gomorrah”; 41 and the other: “Pasiphaë enters the cow, 42 so that the bull may run to her lust”.
**Malay:**
37 Segera setelah mereka meninggalkan sambutan yang ramah, 38 sebelum langkah pertama diambil di sana, 39 masing-masing berusaha untuk berteriak lebih keras dari yang lain:
40 orang-orang baru: "Sodom dan Gomora"; 41 dan yang lainnya: "Di dalam sapi, Pasiphae masuk, 42 agar banteng jantan itu berlari mengejar nafsunya".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Poi, come grue ch’a le montagne Rife 44 volasser parte, e parte inver’ l’arene, 45 queste del gel, quelle del sole schife,
46 l’una gente sen va, l’altra sen vene; 47 e tornan, lagrimando, a’ primi canti 48 e al gridar che più lor si convene;
49 e raccostansi a me, come davanti, 50 essi medesmi che m’avean pregato, 51 attenti ad ascoltar ne’ lor sembianti.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Then, like cranes that fly in a long line 44 some towards the mountains, and some towards the sands, 45 these fleeing from the cold, and those from the sun,
46 one group goes, the other comes; 47 and they return, weeping, to their first songs 48 and to the cries that are most fitting for them;
49 and they gather around me, as before, 50 the same ones who had begged me, 51 attentive to listen in their expressions.
**Malay:**
43 Kemudian, seperti burung bangau yang terbang dalam barisan panjang 44 sebagian menuju pegunungan, dan sebagian menuju pasir, 45 yang ini melarikan diri dari dingin, dan yang itu dari matahari,
46 satu kelompok pergi, yang lain datang; 47 dan mereka kembali, menangis, ke lagu-lagu pertama mereka 48 dan kepada teriakan-teriakan yang paling cocok untuk mereka;
49 dan mereka berkumpul di sekitarku, seperti sebelumnya, 50 orang-orang yang sama yang telah memohon padaku, 51 dengan saksama mendengarkan dalam ekspresi mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Io, che due volte avea visto lor grato, 53 incominciai: «O anime sicure 54 d’aver, quando che sia, di pace stato,
55 non son rimase acerbe né mature 56 le membra mie di là, ma son qui meco 57 col sangue suo e con le sue giunture.
query.result:
**English:**
52 I, who had seen their gratitude twice, 53 began: "O souls secure 54 of having, whenever it may be, a state of peace,
55 my limbs were not left bitter nor ripe 56 on the other side, but they are here with me 57 with their blood and with their joints.
**Malay:**
52 Aku, yang telah melihat rasa terima kasih mereka dua kali, 53 memulai: "Wahai jiwa-jiwa yang aman 54 untuk memiliki, kapan pun itu, keadaan damai,
55 anggota tubuhku tidak tertinggal pahit atau matang 56 di sisi lain, tetapi mereka ada di sini bersamaku 57 dengan darahnya dan dengan persendiannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Quinci sù vo per non esser più cieco; 59 donna è di sopra che m’acquista grazia, 60 per che ’l mortal per vostro mondo reco.
query.result:
**English:**
58 From here I will go up so as not to be blind any more; 59 a lady is above who acquires grace for me, 60 for which the mortal [body] I receive for your world.
**Malay:**
58 Dari sini aku akan naik agar tidak buta lagi; 59 seorang wanita ada di atas yang memberiku rahmat, 60 untuk itu tubuh fana yang kuterima untuk duniamu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Ma se la vostra maggior voglia sazia 62 tosto divegna, sì che ’l ciel v’alberghi 63 ch’è pien d’amore e più ampio si spazia,
64 ditemi, acciò ch’ancor carte ne verghi, 65 chi siete voi, e chi è quella turba 66 che se ne va di retro a’ vostri terghi».
query.result:
**English:**
61 But if your greater desire is soon satisfied, 62 so that Heaven receives you, 63 which is full of love and more spacious,
64 tell me, so that I may still write it down, 65 who you are, and who is that crowd 66 that goes behind your backs."
**Malay:**
61 Tetapi jika keinginan terbesar kalian segera terpenuhi, 62 sehingga Surga menerima kalian, 63 yang penuh dengan cinta dan lebih luas terbentang,
64 katakan padaku, agar aku masih dapat menuliskannya, 65 siapa kalian, dan siapa gerombolan itu 66 yang berjalan di belakang kalian."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Non altrimenti stupido si turba 68 lo montanaro, e rimirando ammuta, 69 quando rozzo e salvatico s’inurba,
70 che ciascun’ ombra fece in sua paruta; 71 ma poi che furon di stupore scarche, 72 lo qual ne li alti cuor tosto s’attuta,
73 «Beato te, che de le nostre marche», 74 ricominciò colei che pria m’inchiese, 75 «per morir meglio, esperïenza imbarche!
76 La gente che non vien con noi, offese 77 di ciò per che già Cesar, trïunfando, 78 “Regina” contra sé chiamar s’intese:
79 però si parton “Soddoma” gridando, 80 rimproverando a sé com’ hai udito, 81 e aiutan l’arsura vergognando.
query.result:
**English:**
67 No otherwise is the mountaineer astounded, 68 and, looking back, is speechless, 69 when he comes into the city, rustic and wild,
70 that each shadow made him start in his way; 71 but after they were relieved of their astonishment, 72 which in lofty hearts is quickly quenched,
73 "Blessed are you who, from our regions," 74 she who had first questioned me began again, 75 "embark on experience in order to die better!
76 The people who do not come with us are offended 77 by that for which Caesar, triumphing, 78 heard himself called "Queen" against his will:
79 therefore they depart crying "Sodom," 80 reproaching themselves as you have heard, 81 and help their burning by being ashamed.
**Malay:**
67 Tidak lain, si pendaki gunung menjadi bingung, 68 dan, menoleh ke belakang, terdiam, 69 ketika ia datang ke kota, kasar dan liar,
70 sehingga setiap bayangan membuatnya terkejut di jalannya; 71 tetapi setelah mereka terbebas dari keterkejutan mereka, 72 yang di hati yang luhur dengan cepat padam,
73 "Berbahagialah kamu yang, dari wilayah kami," 74 ia yang pertama kali menanyaiku memulai lagi, 75 "memulai pengalaman untuk mati dengan lebih baik!
76 Orang-orang yang tidak datang bersama kami tersinggung 77 oleh hal yang membuat Caesar, saat berjaya, 78 mendengar dirinya dipanggil "Ratu" bertentangan dengan keinginannya:
79 oleh karena itu mereka pergi sambil berteriak "Sodom," 80 mencela diri mereka sendiri seperti yang telah kamu dengar, 81 dan membantu pembakaran mereka dengan merasa malu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Nostro peccato fu ermafrodito; 83 ma perché non servammo umana legge, 84 seguendo come bestie l’appetito,
85 in obbrobrio di noi, per noi si legge, 86 quando partinci, il nome di colei 87 che s’imbestiò ne le ’mbestiate schegge.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Our sin was hermaphroditic; 83 but because we did not observe human law, 84 following our appetites like beasts,
85 in our own disgrace, for our own sake, it is read, 86 when we departed, the name of her 87 who gored herself on the bestial splinters.
**Malay:**
82 Dosa kami adalah hermafrodit; 83 tetapi karena kami tidak mematuhi hukum manusia, 84 mengikuti nafsu seperti binatang buas,
85 sebagai aib bagi kami, demi kami sendiri, tertulislah, 86 ketika kami pergi, nama dia 87 yang menusuk dirinya sendiri pada serpihan-serpihan binatang buas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Or sai nostri atti e di che fummo rei: 89 se forse a nome vuo’ saper chi semo, 90 tempo non è di dire, e non saprei.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Now you know our deeds and what we were guilty of: 89 if perhaps you wish to know who we are by name, 90 there is no time to tell, and I would not know.
**Malay:**
88 Sekarang kamu tahu perbuatan kami dan apa yang membuat kami bersalah: 89 jika mungkin kamu ingin tahu siapa kami sebenarnya, 90 tidak ada waktu untuk mengatakannya, dan aku tidak tahu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Farotti ben di me volere scemo: 92 son Guido Guinizzelli, e già mi purgo 93 per ben dolermi prima ch’a lo stremo».
query.result:
**English:**
91 You made me realize how foolish I was: 92 I am Guido Guinizzelli, and I am already purging myself 93 for grieving properly before the end.
**Malay:**
91 Engkau membuatku menyadari betapa bodohnya aku: 92 Aku Guido Guinizzelli, dan aku sudah membersihkan diriku sendiri 93 karena berduka dengan baik sebelum akhir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Quali ne la tristizia di Ligurgo 95 si fer due figli a riveder la madre, 96 tal mi fec’ io, ma non a tanto insurgo,
97 quand’ io odo nomar sé stesso il padre 98 mio e de li altri miei miglior che mai 99 rime d’amore usar dolci e leggiadre;
100 e sanza udire e dir pensoso andai 101 lunga fïata rimirando lui, 102 né, per lo foco, in là più m’appressai.
query.result:
**English:**
94 As in the sadness of Lycurgus 95 two sons stopped to see their mother again, 96 so did I, but I do not rise to such a level,
97 when I heard my father 98 and my other best ones name themselves, 99 who used to use sweet and graceful love poems;
100 and without hearing and speaking, I went thoughtfully 101 for a long time looking at him, 102 and, because of the fire, I did not approach him any further.
**Malay:**
94 Seperti dalam kesedihan Lycurgus 95 dua orang anak berhenti untuk melihat ibu mereka lagi, 96 begitu juga aku, tetapi aku tidak mencapai tingkat seperti itu,
97 ketika aku mendengar ayahku 98 dan yang terbaik lainnya menyebut nama mereka sendiri, 99 yang dulu menggunakan puisi cinta yang manis dan anggun;
100 dan tanpa mendengar dan berbicara, aku pergi dengan penuh pikiran 101 untuk waktu yang lama menatapnya, 102 dan, karena api, aku tidak mendekatinya lebih jauh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Poi che di riguardar pasciuto fui, 104 tutto m’offersi pronto al suo servigio 105 con l’affermar che fa credere altrui.
query.result:
**English:**
103 After I had fed my eyes with gazing, 104 I offered myself completely to his service 105 with the affirmation that makes others believe.
**Malay:**
103 Setelah mataku puas memandang, 104 aku menawarkan diriku sepenuhnya untuk melayaninya 105 dengan penegasan yang membuat orang lain percaya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Ed elli a me: «Tu lasci tal vestigio, 107 per quel ch’i’ odo, in me, e tanto chiaro, 108 che Letè nol può tòrre né far bigio.
query.result:
**English:**
106 And he to me: "You leave such a trace, 107 from what I hear, in me, and so clear, 108 that Lethe cannot take it away or make it dim.
**Malay:**
106 Dan dia kepadaku: "Kamu meninggalkan jejak seperti itu, 107 dari apa yang kudengar, di dalam diriku, dan begitu jelas, 108 sehingga Lethe tidak dapat menghapusnya atau membuatnya redup.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Ma se le tue parole or ver giuraro, 110 dimmi che è cagion per che dimostri 111 nel dire e nel guardar d’avermi caro».
query.result:
**English:**
109 But if your words now swear truly, 110 tell me what is the reason that you show 111 in your words and in your gaze that you hold me dear.
**Malay:**
109 Tetapi jika kata-katamu sekarang bersumpah benar, 110 katakan padaku apa sebabnya kamu menunjukkan 111 dalam perkataan dan pandanganmu bahwa kamu menyayangiku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 E io a lui: «Li dolci detti vostri, 113 che, quanto durerà l’uso moderno, 114 faranno cari ancora i loro incostri».
query.result:
**English:**
112 And I to him: "Your sweet words, 113 which, as long as modern usage shall endure, 114 will make their inks precious still."
**Malay:**
112 Dan aku kepadanya: "Kata-kata manismu, 113 yang, selama penggunaan modern masih ada, 114 akan membuat tinta mereka tetap berharga."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 «O frate», disse, «questi ch’io ti cerno 116 col dito», e additò un spirto innanzi, 117 «fu miglior fabbro del parlar materno.
query.result:
**English:**
115 "O brother," he said, "this one whom I point out to you 116 with my finger," and he pointed to a spirit in front of us, 117 "was a better craftsman of the mother tongue.
**Malay:**
115 "Wahai saudara," katanya, "orang yang kutunjuk ini 116 dengan jariku," dan dia menunjuk ke arah roh di depan kami, 117 "adalah pandai besi terbaik dalam bahasa ibu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Versi d’amore e prose di romanzi 119 soverchiò tutti; e lascia dir li stolti 120 che quel di Lemosì credon ch’avanzi.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Verses of love and prose of romances 119 he surpassed all; and let the fools say 120 that they believe the one from Limoges is better.
**Malay:**
118 Sajak cinta dan prosa roman 119 melampaui semuanya; dan biarkan orang bodoh berkata 120 bahwa mereka percaya yang dari Limoges lebih baik.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 A voce più ch’al ver drizzan li volti, 122 e così ferman sua oppinïone 123 prima ch’arte o ragion per lor s’ascolti.
query.result:
**English:**
121 With a voice louder than is true, they direct their faces, 122 and thus they establish their opinion 123 before art or reason is heard by them.
**Malay:**
121 Dengan suara yang lebih keras daripada kebenaran, mereka mengarahkan wajah mereka, 122 dan dengan demikian mereka menetapkan pendapat mereka 123 sebelum seni atau alasan didengar oleh mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Così fer molti antichi di Guittone, 125 di grido in grido pur lui dando pregio, 126 fin che l’ha vinto il ver con più persone.
query.result:
**English:**
124 Thus for many of the ancients of Guittone, 125 from shout to shout, also giving him praise, 126 until the truth has won him over with more people.
**Malay:**
124 Begitulah bagi banyak orang tua Guittone, 125 dari teriakan ke teriakan, juga memberinya pujian, 126 hingga kebenaran telah memenangkannya dengan lebih banyak orang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Or se tu hai sì ampio privilegio, 128 che licito ti sia l’andare al chiostro 129 nel quale è Cristo abate del collegio,
130 falli per me un dir d’un paternostro, 131 quanto bisogna a noi di questo mondo, 132 dove poter peccar non è più nostro».
query.result:
**English:**
127 Now if you have such ample privilege, 128 that it is permitted for you to go to the cloister 129 in which Christ is abbot of the college,
130 say a paternoster for me, 131 as much as we need in this world, 132 where it is no longer in our power to sin."
**Malay:**
127 Sekarang jika kamu memiliki hak istimewa yang begitu besar, 128 sehingga kamu diizinkan untuk pergi ke biara 129 di mana Kristus adalah kepala biara dari perkumpulan itu,
130 ucapkanlah doa Bapa Kami untukku, 131 sebanyak yang kita butuhkan di dunia ini, 132 di mana kita tidak lagi memiliki kuasa untuk berbuat dosa."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 Poi, forse per dar luogo altrui secondo 134 che presso avea, disparve per lo foco, 135 come per l’acqua il pesce andando al fondo.
query.result:
**English:**
133 Then, perhaps to give place to another behind 134 who was near, he disappeared through the fire, 135 as a fish through the water, going to the bottom.
**Malay:**
133 Kemudian, mungkin untuk memberi tempat kepada orang lain di belakang 134 yang berada di dekatnya, dia menghilang melalui api, 135 seperti ikan melalui air, menuju ke dasar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 Io mi fei al mostrato innanzi un poco, 137 e dissi ch’al suo nome il mio disire 138 apparecchiava grazïoso loco.
query.result:
**English:**
136 I made myself a little in front of the monster, 137 and I said that my desire prepared 138 a gracious place for his name.
**Malay:**
136 Aku membuat diriku sedikit di depan monster itu, 137 dan aku berkata bahwa keinginanku menyiapkan 138 tempat yang ramah untuk namanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 El cominciò liberamente a dire: 140 «Tan m’abellis vostre cortes deman, 141 qu’ieu no me puesc ni voill a vos cobrire.
query.result:
**English:**
139 He began to speak freely, saying: 140 "Your courteous request does not please me, 141 for I cannot and will not hide from you.
**Malay:**
139 Ia mula bercakap dengan bebas, berkata: 140 "Permintaan sopan kamu tidak menyenangkan aku, 141 karena aku tidak dapat dan tidak akan menyembunyikan diri darimu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
142 Ieu sui Arnaut, que plor e vau cantan; 143 consiros vei la passada folor, 144 e vei jausen lo joi qu’esper, denan.
query.result:
**English:**
142 I am Arnaut, who weeps and goes singing; 143 sorrowful I see the past pain, 144 and already I see with joy what I hope for, in front of me.
**Malay:**
142 Akulah Arnaut, yang menangis dan berjalan sambil bernyanyi; 143 dengan sedih aku melihat kesedihan masa lalu, 144 dan sekarang aku melihat dengan gembira apa yang kuharapkan, di depanku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
145 Ara vos prec, per aquella valor 146 que vos guida al som de l’escalina, 147 sovenha vos a temps de ma dolor!».
query.result:
**English:**
145 Now I pray you, by that power 146 that guided you to the top of the stairway, 147 remember my pain in time!».
**Malay:**
145 Sekarang aku mohon padamu, dengan kekuatan itu 146 yang membimbingmu ke puncak tangga, 147 ingatlah kesakitanku pada waktunya!».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
148 Poi s’ascose nel foco che li affina.
query.result:
**English:**
148 Then he hid himself in the fire that refines them.
**Malay:**
148 Kemudian dia menyembunyikan dirinya di dalam api yang memurnikan mereka.
